017package com.github.tommyettinger.kryo.gdx;
018
019import com.badlogic.gdx.utils.Array;
020import com.esotericsoftware.kryo.Kryo;
021import com.esotericsoftware.kryo.Serializer;
022import com.esotericsoftware.kryo.io.Input;
023import com.esotericsoftware.kryo.io.Output;
024
025/**
026 * A Serializer for libGDX {@link Array} objects.
027 * This was copied almost-directly from <a href="https://github.com/CypherCove/GdxToKryo/blob/d6c626ee0b06476877e75f22393572007aaf69fe/library/src/main/java/com/cyphercove/gdxtokryo/gdxserializers/utils/ArraySerializer.java">CypherCove's GdxToKryo repo</a>.
028 * This is not recommended for use from outside code, because it could be moved into a different project.
029 * <br>
030 * Unlike the original, this does not record the Class of items of an Array. That requires registering Object for most
031 * Array instances, and I'm not sure if that's a good idea.
032 */
033public class ArraySerializer extends Serializer<Array> {
034    @Override
035    public void write(Kryo kryo, Output output, Array array) {
036        output.writeVarInt(array.size, true);
037        output.writeBoolean(array.ordered);
038        for (Object element : array)
039            kryo.writeClassAndObject(output, element);
040    }
041
042    protected Array<?> create (boolean ordered, int capacity) {
043        return (new Array<>(ordered, capacity));
044    }
045
046    @Override
047    public Array read(Kryo kryo, Input input, Class<? extends Array> type) {
048        int length = input.readVarInt(true);
049        boolean ordered = input.readBoolean();
050        Array array = create(ordered, length);
051        kryo.reference(array);
052        for (int i = 0; i < length; i++)
053            array.add(kryo.readClassAndObject(input));
054        return array;
055    }
056
057    @Override
058    public Array copy (Kryo kryo, Array original) {
059        Class cls = original.items.getClass().getComponentType();
060        Array<?> copy = new Array<>(original.ordered, original.size, cls);
061        kryo.reference(copy);
062        copy.addAll(original);
063        return copy;
064    }
065}
